net.proteusframework.users.model.dao

Class PrincipalDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.i2rd.hibernate.AbstractProcessor<Principal>
      • net.proteusframework.users.model.dao.PrincipalDAO
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.i2rd.hibernate.EntityProcessor<Principal>, InitializingBean

    @Repository
public class PrincipalDAO
extends com.i2rd.hibernate.AbstractProcessor<Principal>
    Default processor for Principal.
    Author:
    Ken Logan (ken@i2rd.com)

      • addToGroup

        public boolean addToGroup(Principal principal,
                 PrincipalGroup principalGroup)
        Assigns a Principal to a PrincipalGroup if the Principal is not already in the group. The entity arguments may be detached.
        Parameters:
        principal - the Principal, not null
        principalGroup - the group, not null
        Returns:
        true if the Principal was not already in the group and has been added

                                            AuthenticationDomain auth)
                                              throws IllegalArgumentException

        Parameters:

        auth - The authentication domain, can be null

      • authenticatePrincipalLoginAs

        public void authenticatePrincipalLoginAs(Principal loginPrincipal,
                                Principal asPrincipal)
                                  throws org.acegisecurity.AuthenticationException
        Authenticate a principal using login-as (without providing credentials). Authenticates using credentials of one principal, after authentication a different principal is logged in. NOTE: Applications should redirect to a page with a generator that clears (clears, not invalidates) the session in preRenderProcess before calling this method for general-purpose login-as functionality.
        Parameters:
        loginPrincipal - use credentials of this principal to log in
        asPrincipal - login as this principal
        Throws:
        org.acegisecurity.AuthenticationException - if the login-as operation is not allowed

                                         AuthenticationMethodSecurityLevel level)
        Authenticate a principal (without providing credentials).
        Parameters:
        principal - The principal
        level - the security level

      • authenticatePrincipalProgrammatically

        public void authenticatePrincipalProgrammatically(Principal principal,
                                         AuthenticationMethodSecurityLevel level,
                                         Credentials credentials)
        Authenticate a principal with specific credentials. The credentials are only used for informational purposes to know which particular credentials were used for logging in.
        Parameters:
        principal - The principal
        level - the security level
        credentials - the credentials used to authenticate the principal, may be null

      • authenticatePrincipalProgrammatically

        public void authenticatePrincipalProgrammatically(String name,
                                         AuthenticationDomain authDomain)
                                           throws IllegalArgumentException
        Authenticate a principal (without providing credentials).
        Parameters:
        name - the principal's login name
        authDomain - The authentication domain (can be null)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - If named principal is not available.

      • authenticatePrincipalWithPassword

        public void authenticatePrincipalWithPassword(AuthenticationDomain authDomain,
                                     String loginName,
                                     String password,
                                     org.acegisecurity.ui.WebAuthenticationDetails webAuth)
                                       throws org.acegisecurity.AuthenticationException
        Authenticate a principal using a username and password. Equivalent acegi events will be fired for both successful and unsuccessful authentication. The principal must have a status of PrincipalStatus.active to authenticate successfully. To handle cases where a principal has a status of pending or suspended, use (AuthenticationDomain, String, String) to check the validity of the credentials and getPrincipalByLogin(String, AuthenticationDomain) to be able to check that Principal's status.
        Parameters:
        authDomain - the authentication domain. This can be null which will only return principals that have no domains. (no domain represents a default domain)
        loginName - the user name.
        password - the password.
        webAuth - the web authentication details.
        Throws:
        org.acegisecurity.AuthenticationException - if the principal cannot be authenticated.

      • checkAuthenticationCredentials

        public boolean checkAuthenticationCredentials(AuthenticationDomain authDomain,
                                     String loginName,
                                     String password)
        Check if the login name and password are valid for the domain. This does not authenticate the principal. It returns true if there is a login with the given login name and password in the given domain.
        Parameters:
        authDomain - the authentication domain. This can be null which will only return principals that have no domains. (no domain represents a default domain)
        loginName - the user name.
        password - the password.
        Returns:
        true if there is a valid principal account that matches the criteria.

        public boolean checkPassword(String raw,
                    PasswordCredentials pwcred)
        Check the validity of a password
        Parameters:
        raw - the raw password
        pwcred - the password credential
        Returns:
        true if the password is valid, false if not

        public boolean checkUsernameExists(String username,
                          AuthenticationDomain domain)
        Check to see if a username already exists in a given auth domain. If no domain is specified users across all domains will be checked
        Parameters:
        username - - the username
        domain - - the auth domain
        Returns:
        - true if the username exists.

      • createAndAuthenticateNewPrincipal

        public Principal createAndAuthenticateNewPrincipal(AuthenticationMethodSecurityLevel level,
                                          List<AuthenticationDomain> authDomains,
                                          Role role)
                                            throws NonUniqueCredentialsException
        Create a new principal. This will replace any currently authenticated principal as being the current principal.
        Parameters:
        level - The security level to authenticate with.
        authDomains - the authentication domains the principal will reside in. Can be empty, which implies a logical default domain.
        role - An optional role to add to the new principal. This can be null
        Returns:
        A persisted, and authenticated Principal.
        Throws:
        NonUniqueCredentialsException - If the specified user name is not unique for all of the auth domains

      • createNewPrincipal

        public Principal createNewPrincipal(List<AuthenticationDomain> authDomains,
                           Role role)
                             throws NonUniqueCredentialsException
        Create a new principal.
        Parameters:
        authDomains - the authentication domains the principal will reside in. Can be empty, which implies a logical default domain.
        role - An optional role to add to the new principal. This can be null
        Returns:
        A persisted, and authenticated Principal.
        Throws:
        NonUniqueCredentialsException - If the specified user name is not unique for all of the auth domains

      • createOrRetrieveAuthenticatedPrincipal

        public Principal createOrRetrieveAuthenticatedPrincipal(String userName,
                                               String password,
                                               Contact contact,
                                               Role role,
                                               List<AuthenticationDomain> authDomains)
                                                 throws NonUniqueCredentialsException,
                                                        BadPasswordException
        Common logic for creating a new principal taking into consideration a currently authenticated principal. If a principal is currently authenticated using a password (or any shared secret) then a new principal with the specified username and password is created. If a principal is authenticated using any weaker method of authentication then the current principal is used and a password is setup. The returned principal will be authenticated using AuthenticationMethodSecurityLevel.SHARED_SECRET level of authentication.
        Parameters:
        userName - the user name for the principal
        password - the password to set for the principal
        contact - contact for the principal. When an existing principal is used, all of the non-null properties of this contact will be copied to the existing principal's contact.
        role - an optional Role to add to the principal. This can be null.
        authDomains - the authentication domains the principal will reside in. Can be empty, which implies a logical default domain.
        Returns:
        the principal which may or may not be newly created, but will be updated.
        Throws:
        NonUniqueCredentialsException - If the user name is not unique within all of the specified authentication domains. The absence of any authentication domain is considered to be a default authentication domain.
        BadPasswordException - if the password is bad.

      • currentPrincipalHasPermission

        public boolean currentPrincipalHasPermission(AcegiPermission perm)
        Check if the currently authenticated principal has a certain permission.
        Parameters:
        perm - the permission to check.
        Returns:
        true if and only if the currently authenticated principal has the permission.

      • encodePasswordForSetting

        public String encodePasswordForSetting(String raw,
                              PasswordCredentials pwcred)
        Encode a raw password for the purpose of setting a new passord. Unlike the encodePassword() method, this one will always use the most recent password credential version.
        Parameters:
        raw - the raw password
        pwcred - the password credentials.
        Returns:
        The encoded password.

      • generateDefaultUsername

        public String generateDefaultUsername(Principal principal,
                             AuthenticationDomain domain)
        Generates a username based on the given principal and authentication domain. The username is not guarenteed to be unique after generation as this function does nothing to reserve it. If the principal lacks sufficient information, this function will return an empty string.
        Parameters:
        principal - The principal.
        domain - The domain.
        Returns:
        The username or an empty string if generation isn't possible.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getCurrentCredentials

        public Credentials getCurrentCredentials()
        Get the credentials used to authenticate the current principal. This may be null even if a principal is currently logged in. The application that handles the authentication is responsible for storing the credentials used. Since they are for informational purposes only, applications are not required to store credentials, and sometimes no credentials are used at all to authenticate a user.
        Returns:
        the credentials

      • getCurrentPrincipal

        @Nullable
public Principal getCurrentPrincipal()
        Get the current principal from acegi.
        Returns:
        the current principal or null if there isn't a current principal.

      • getCurrentPrincipalPreferredLocale

        @Nullable
public Locale getCurrentPrincipalPreferredLocale()
        Get the currently authenticated principal's preferred locale.
        Returns:
        The current principal's preferred locale, or null if there is none.

        principal - a Principal, not null
        Returns:
        a list of all PrincipalGroups that have the given Principal as a member; modifying the returned list has no side effects

      • getPrincipalsByMultiple

        public List<Principal> getPrincipalsByMultiple(@Nullable
                                      Collection<Role> roles,
                                      @Nullable
                                      Collection<PrincipalGroup> groups,
                                      @Nullable
                                      Collection<AuthenticationDomain> domains,
                                      @Nullable
                                      String firstName,

                                      String lastName,
                                      @Nullable
                                      String login,
                                      @Nullable
                                      Collection<Principal> exclude,
                                      int limit,
                                      boolean substring)
        Search for principals based on any of these criteria. Only principals that have password credentials are returned.

        roles - The roles to search across
        groups - The principal groups to search across

        lastName - The last name to search for

        exclude - Principals to exclude in the search
        limit - The limit of results
        substring - True if substring matches are okay. False if exact matches are required
        Returns:
        The principals matching the criteria

      • getPrincipalsWithExplicitlyAssignedPermission

        public Collection<Principal> getPrincipalsWithExplicitlyAssignedPermission(AcegiPermission permission)
        Get all of the principals that have a specified permission explicitly assigned to them or one of their assigned roles. Does not include Principals that may have the permission implicitly via another permission implying the specified permission. Note: the implementation of this is somewhat expensive, you may want to cache the return data instead of calling repeatedly.
        Parameters:
        permission - the permission
        Returns:
        the collection of principals with the specified permission expliclitly assigned.

                  com.i2rd.util.ProgressListener progressListener)
                    throws HibernateException

        dest - the destination principal.

      • removePrincipalFromAuthenticationDomain

        public void removePrincipalFromAuthenticationDomain(Principal principal,
                                           AuthenticationDomain domain)
        Updates the principal so that the principal can no longer authenticate to the specified authentication domain. If the principal was only active on the specified domain, then the principal's credentials will be removed and the principal's status will be updated to closed. If the principal is active on multiple domains, then the principal's status is left unchanged, but the principal is removed from the specified domain. If the principal is not able to authenticate to the specified domain, then no update is performed and the method returns uneventfully. The result of this operation is that the username that was "reserved" for the principal is now available again. This operation roughly mimics deletion of a principal (because deletion is not implemented).
        Parameters:
        principal - the principal (cannot be null, can be detached)
        domain - the authentication domain (cannot be null, can be detached)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if either param is null

      • setNewPassword

        public boolean setNewPassword(Principal p,
                     String username,
                     List<Notification> notifications,
                     String password)
                       throws NonUniqueCredentialsException
        Set a new password on the specified principal. Will add the old password to the password history and unexpire the existing PasswordCredentials if they are expired. If no password credentials found for specified username, then one will be created.
        Parameters:
        p - the principal
        username - The username of the password credentials to set.
        notifications - to populate with issues setting the password.
        password - the new password.
        Returns:
        true if successful, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        NonUniqueCredentialsException - Cannot use new userName, its been taken already.
